document.docAuthor: Irfan, Muhammad, Bashir, Shahida & Peng, Xianjin
document.docTitle: Acroterius camur Irfan & Bashir & Peng 2021, gen. et sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Acroterius gen. nov. (Araneae: Linyphiidae: Linyphiinae) with twelve new species from Yunnan, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Acroterius gen. nov. (Araneae: Linyphiidae: Linyphiinae) with twelve new species from Yunnan, China

subSubSection.paragraph:
The new species resembles
Acroterius brevis
gen. et sp. nov. ( Figs 6A–D , 7A–B ) in having similar embolus in the male palp and a short parmula in the epigyne ( Figs 10A–D , 11A–D , 12A–B ) as in
A. inversus
gen. et sp. nov. and
A. longidentatus
gen. et sp. nov. ; it can be distinguished by the distal arm of paracymbium with three projections and similar embolus, the radical thumb-shaped apophysis extends above the embolus in ventral view ( Figs 10D , 12A ), but is triangular and reaches to the base of the embolus in
A. brevis
gen. et sp. nov. ( Figs 6D , 7A ). Spermathecae hook-shaped, separated by one and half-length of spermathecae ( Fig. 13A–B ), but L-shaped and present near the posterior median plate in
A. brevis
gen. et sp. nov. ( Fig. 8A–D ). Parmula somewhat triangular ( Fig. 13A–D ), but tongue-shaped in
A. brevis
gen. et sp. nov. ( Fig. 8A–C ), anteriorly rectangular and posteriorly spoon-shaped in
A. inversus
gen. et sp. nov. ( Fig. 22A–C ), finger-shaped in
A. longidentatus
gen. et sp. nov. ( Fig. 29A–C ).

The species name comes from the Latin adjective ‘
camur
’, meaning ‘curved’ and referring to the curved distal suprategular apophysis in the male palp.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 10.
Acroterius camur
gen. et sp. nov. , ♂, holotype (HNU-DHK–2002–038), palp. A . Prolateral view. B . Retrolateral view. C . Dorsal view. D . Ventral view.

Fig. 11.
Acroterius camur
gen. et sp. nov. , ♂, holotype (HNU-DHK–2002–038). A–B . Embolic division, ventral view. C . Embolic division, prolateral view. D . Embolic division, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: PALP ( Figs 10A–D , 11A–D , 12A–B ). Paracymbium highly sclerotized, distal arm with two projections; lateral projection small, somewhat triangular; ventral projection small with blunt end ( Figs 10B , 12B ); distal suprategular apophysis long, robust, distal part slightly curved with pointed end ( Figs 10A–C , 12A–B ). Radical apophysis thumb-shaped with blunt end extending above the embolus in ventral view ( Figs 10A–D , 11A–D , 12A–B ). Embolus stout, short with pointed end ( Figs 10A–D , 11A–D , 12A–B ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 12.
Acroterius camur
gen. et sp. nov. , ♂, holotype (HNU-DHK–2002–038), palp. A . Prolateral view. B . Retrolateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: CHELICERAE. With five promarginal and six retromarginal teeth; proximal teeth of reteromargin are much longer than distal one.
